item.title: Report E-2024050414
item.description:
Report E-2024050414

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-24T15:13:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-13
  • City: W VALLEY CITY
  • State: UT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 3000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On May 13, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of corrosive liquid was punctured by a nail in transit and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EnviroServe (ES) to remediate the impacted site. ES personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted trailer and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum. The damaged 55-gallon drum of product was placed into one (1) 95-gallon drum.

item.title: Report E-2024050348
item.description:
Report E-2024050348

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-20T15:12:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-16
  • City: SALT LAKE CITY
  • State: UT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 12500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal USU experienced a UN1198 Formaldehyde Solution 37% 14% release from a 55-gallon poly drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately all 55-gallons of material released to the trailer and dock floor in a 1’ x 200’ area and a 10’ x 10’ area due to a forklift puncture. The damaged drum was placed into a 95-gallon poly overpack. Absorbents were then deployed to collect all free liquids. A pressure washer was utilized to further clean the impacted doc area and all wastewater was solidified with absorbents. The impacted absorbents and PPE used were then collected and containerized into (4) 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.
